Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored the winning goal in the 112th minute following a turnover.
Colombia’s 28-game international win streak ended with this loss.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina, the defending champions of the tournament and World Cup winners in 2022, were the favorites of the tournament and never trailed during the competition.
Lionel Messi was subbed out in the 66th minute with an ankle injury and did not play the final.
Post-Match Reflections: Lautaro Martínez of Argentina celebrated with teammates after scoring the winning goal.
The game was marred by a delay of more than an hour due to fans rushing the stadium and trying to get inside.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans, many of whom didn’t have tickets, rushed the stadium and tried to get inside, causing a delay.
Colombia played without defender Daniel Muñoz, who was sent off after an altercation and a second yellow card in the first half against Uruguay in the semifinal.
